The Heavenly Worthy declares: The Nine Mounds of the Earth Sovereign are governed by one thousand two hundred spirits, including the Earth Lords, Earth Marshals, Earth Lords and Ladies, Earth Children and Grandchildren, and their entire earthly retinue. Among them are the Year Star, the General Star, the Crane Spirit, Venus, the Nine Auspicious Stars, the Sword Blade, the Male and Female Stars, the Metal Spirit, the Fire and Blood Spirits, the Yellow Body, the Life-Striker, the Three Sha, the Seven Sha, the Yellow Banner and Leopard Tail, the Flying Edge and Execution Block—such are the earthly spirits and malevolent stars. Should one undertake construction or divination and inadvertently offend them, illness, misfortune, and even death may follow. But upon reciting this scripture, all spirits rise in response, and there shall be no taboos in heaven, no taboos on earth, no taboos in yin and yang, and no prohibitions whatsoever.

Annotation: Whenever one undertakes construction or begins a project, one may unwittingly offend these spirits and malevolent stars, bringing immediate calamity. At worst, it leads to death; at best, lawsuits and disputes. How can one not be cautious? By following the rituals, inscribing the talismans, reciting the scripture, and offering prayers, all taboos are lifted.

Exegesis: The Heavenly Worthy cherishes all living beings to such an extent. It is said that we live upon the earth and return to the earth in death, yet few realize how profoundly the earth can harm. For the earth prefers stillness and resists disturbance.

Commentary: Heaven covers the earth—who does not know this? Yet our Heavenly Worthy, as the supreme lord of the Nine Heavens, governs the Three Realms. The Nine Mounds’ Sovereign, his spring retinue, and his many malevolent ministers inflict grave harm upon humanity. The Heavenly Worthy employs the jade script and precious talismans to suppress and dispel them, ensuring that all—from the wise to the foolish—may act without taboos.

Eulogy:
All things arise from earth,
And inadvertent offense brings disaster.
Were it not for the power of the true scripture of Universal Transformation,
Everywhere would be heaps of white bones.

The Heavenly Worthy declares: When worldly men and women marry, they may offend the Salty Pond, the Heavenly Dog, the Three Punishments, the Six Harms, the intersecting angles, the solitary yin and solitary yang, the Heavenly Net and Earthly Snare, leading to difficulties in bearing children and a life of solitude. If one seeks a son, recite this scripture, and the Great Spirit of the Nine Heavens who oversees birth will summon the spirits and command the winds, bringing forth a worthy child. At the time of birth, the Great Unity stands at the door, and the Controller of Destinies waits in the courtyard.

Should grievances, grudges, malevolent spirits, or taboos arise—should ill fortune or calamity strike—causing difficult labor, recite this scripture, and the Nine Heavens’ Guardians of the Chamber will attend, while the Holy Mother silently assists in delivery, ensuring the birth is joyous and the labor free from peril.

For infants in swaddling, tormented by the fifteen kinds of ghosts under the Sandalwood Spirit-King, afflicted with fright and convulsions, this scripture should be recited.

**Annotation:** In marriage and childbirth, all mortals contend with spirit perils. Unaware of directions, heedless of the Grand Year-Star, they may inadvertently offend—such transgressions bear grave consequences. Hasten to recite the scripture and burn talismans to avert misfortune, and peace and prosperity will follow.

**Exegesis:** Fortune and misfortune stand as two paths, ever intertwined. Should discord or barrenness arise, invoke the Heavenly Worthy’s name but once, and all shall dissolve of itself.

**Exposition:** This chapter binds mortal marriage and progeny to the Heavenly Worthy’s dominion. The begetting, betrothal, and rearing of children are no trifling matters. Yet worldly custom, blind to such truths, stumbles into private miscalculations—errors manifold. Should offense occur, husband north and wife south, children will come only with great difficulty. Recite the precious scripture and burn sacred talismans to dispel it, and naturally husband and wife will harmonize, their descendants flourishing.

**Eulogy:**
Marriage is the bond of human relations,
Sons and daughters the love of flesh and bone.
To make the household thrive in accord,
Revere the Jade Pivot’s text.

The Heavenly Worthy declares: Where men dwell, crows and rats deliver omens, serpents and insects sow corruption, bricks and tiles are hurled, chickens startled, dogs provoked, and offerings demanded—even spectral coercion and dream oppression, or worse, theft and debauchery. Should such spirits dare claim a dwelling as their lair, the living will be bewildered. The courtyard and home grow unclean; by night, wailing echoes in the rafters; by day, unseen eyes peer into the chamber. Cattle, horses, dogs, and swine suffer pestilence; calamity clings to kin, disaster befalls livestock. Lewd shrines and heretical altars shelter wicked spirits, while mourners arrive in droves and funeral biers depart in succession. Recite this scripture, and instantly ghostly essences vanish, men and creatures alike find peace.

**Annotation:** Such households, scorning moral principles and the Dao of proper conduct, defy the gods of Heaven and Earth. Their mouths reek of foul meat and rank flesh; their bodies tread paths of lust and slaughter. They flout public law, pursuing only private gain, unleashing venom and violence, indulging every vice. Thus do they provoke the envy of ghosts and the wrath of spirits, summoning malevolent forces. Yet should they repent, confess their faults, recite the scripture, and burn talismans, misfortune will cease, and all will dwell in tranquility.

**Exegesis:** When walls crumble, thieves enter; when karma weighs heavy, ghosts arrive, bringing disaster to livestock and misfortune to household spirits. The Heavenly Worthy, not dismissing even minor transgressions, extends great mercy—recite the scripture often, and calamity will halt.

**Exposition:** When the upright qi is as vast as Heaven, no demon dares encroach. Yet mortals, mismanaging their households, offend the divine intelligence, driving away the Six Spirits, allowing perverse qi to seize the moment. Rat spirits and serpent specters hurl objects and sow chaos; blood-yin strikes without warning, even tainting household members—such perils defy prediction. Or thieves may pilfer goods, shifting things from east to west—all of this kind. Thus do mourners and death-portents run rampant, spirits emboldened to act as they please. Recite the precious scripture and burn jade talismans, and both people and creatures will find peace.

**Eulogy:**
When one does evil, evil arises;
When one acts with virtue, Heaven acts in kind.
Should mortals face such trials,
Inscribe sacred talismans and recite the precious scripture.

The Heavenly Worthy says: The Nine Heavens’ Thunder Duke Generals, the Five Directions’ Thunder Duke Generals, the Eight Directions’ Cloud-Thunder Generals, the Five Directions’ Barbarian Thunder Envoys, the Thunder Department’s Marshal Commanders, the Deceptive Illusion Judges—all issue commands swift as wind and fire. Where there are temples to strike, altars to smite, demons to purge, or malevolent forces to banish, they act. In this degenerate age of declining Dharma, many are the shamans and sorcerers; perverse arts spread, and yin forces freely cast their curses.

Thus, in the Supreme Clarity, there stands the Celestial Court for Binding Ghosts and Registering the Wicked, the Imperial Chamber for Restraining Demons and Interrogating the Perverse. Those who recite this scripture shall find their prayers answered as swiftly as an echo.

**Annotation:** Among the twenty-one sections of this scripture, all are the words of the Heavenly Worthy, yet only this chapter begins with "The Heavenly Worthy says." This is because it extols the Thunder Duke Generals, Envoys, and Judges, who issue commands and manifest their awe-inspiring virtue in instant response. Thus, it does not speak directly.

The followers of shamans and sorcerers, devoted to perverse arts, recklessly fabricate demonic words, casting curses to sunder husbands and wives, or employing bewitchments to entice women into illicit unions. When such malevolent sorcerers are encountered, recite the precious scripture and burn the sacred talismans, and the Thunder Bureau shall eradicate them, meting out retribution as swiftly as an echo, so that people may find peace.

**Exegesis:** Heaven and Earth are impartial, aiding only those of virtue. The retribution for good and evil moves as swiftly as shadow and echo. Those who cultivate the Dao, embodying the heart of Heaven and illuminating their own hearts, shall see misfortunes dispelled and blessings and prosperity arrive.

**Commentary:** This chapter is the Heavenly Worthy’s own praise of the Thunder Bureau’s sagacity. For this reason, it slays ghosts, severs evil, summons clouds, and brings rain—all by the Heavenly Worthy’s command, enacted below. Yet in this age, the sacred and the profane are often indistinguishable. Some employ unorthodox arts to corrupt human relations and violate the law. Recite this precious scripture and burn the talismans, and the response shall be as swift as an echo. How can one not revere and fear this?

**Eulogy:**
The Thunder Bureau discerns good and evil,
Uprooting evil and rescuing the good,
Ever eradicating perverse arts that bring harm.
Recite the Jade Pivot often.

The Heavenly Worthy says:
Heavenly pestilences, earthly pestilences—twenty-five in all.
Heavenly gu, earthly gu—twenty-four in all.
Heavenly consumptive afflictions, earthly consumptive afflictions—thirty-six in all.
Those who recite this scripture shall find pestilences purified,
gu poisons dissolved,
and consumptive afflictions healed.

There are reasons for these afflictions:
Some arise from the lingering influence of the long-dead,
or from the residual qi of corpses,
or from lawsuits over graves and tomb curses,
or from the contamination of dead spirits,
or from the summoning by corpse qi.
All such ghosts and spirits—whether moved by sorrow,
or bound by resentment and entanglement—
cast their baleful influence like arrows.
Seizing every opportunity, they strike when least expected.

Thus this scripture reaches upward to the Three Heavens and penetrates downward to the Nine Springs. It can summon and deliver the wandering souls, transcend and ferry the ancestral generations, for the Most High dispatches the Great General of the White Chariot and White Horses to oversee the rite.

Annotation states: All who suffer from pestilences, gu, or consumptive afflictions have brought them upon themselves—so severe that entire households may perish, and six relations be entangled. Yet if one recites the scripture with sincere devotion and burns the talismanic writs, the Thunder Bureau shall dispatch the generals of the White Chariot and White Horses to extricate them, sparing them from this suffering.

Exposition states: Pestilences, gu, and healing afflictions have their origins. But if one purifies the heart, maintains personal purity, recites the true scripture, and pays homage to the Heavenly Worthy, one shall not fall prey to this suffering.

Exegesis states: Pestilence arises from impure qi, gu from shadowless worms, and consumptive afflictions from hard-to-cure illnesses. Why does the Heavenly Worthy speak of these three? They too have their origins—stemming from lingering connections and contagion, corpse qi and mutual defilement, or tomb lawsuits and spectral summons. Lingering connections are humanity’s great calamity; the world does not know how to perform exorcisms, hence entire families perish. Tomb lawsuits are the governance of the seven ancestral generations’ grievances. Corpse qi arises from ancient coffins in the earth, which transform into tiny insects that may fly into food or fall into vessels; when consumed, they cause gu. When moving residences, one should recite the scripture and burn talismans to eradicate them.

Eulogy states: The great suffering of heaven-and-earth’s pestilences, gu, and consumptive afflictions has its causes, yet it is also self-inflicted.

If one recites the Mysterious Writ, one may rescue the seven ancestral generations, and the White Horse General will act as their protector.

The Heavenly Worthy states: Should one prepare for a distant journey, bandits and thieves may scheme, and the five weapons bring harm. On land, tigers, wolves, mountain spirits, and venomous creatures sharpen their fangs; on water, dragons and alligators gape their jaws. One may encounter the grievances of wronged souls or the predestined trials of wind and waves. The departed may seize the living to replace the dead. Yet if one surrenders body and heart to this scripture, one shall traverse land and water in peace, and all undertakings shall be auspicious.

Annotation states: When traveling by land, one may meet bandits or armed conflict, or encounter serpents, tigers, or malevolent mountain spirits. When traveling by water, one may face dragons, turtles, or alligators stirring waves and winds, or lost souls seeking substitutes. One may suffer predestined trials or be cast adrift in distant lands. Always prepare talismans to guard against these perils; they may be burned in water or fire, or one may urgently recite the sacred name to instantly avert all calamities.

Exegesis states: In all movements and stillness, one must be cautious and vigilant. If one has long upheld this scripture, how could such misfortunes arise?

Exposition states: In all actions and repose, one must be prudent. For fortune and misfortune, clarity and obscurity arise from movement. Thus, in every movement, only one outcome is auspicious—the other three are not. How can one not be careful? Before embarking on a journey, one must first recite the sacred scripture and wear its talismans; then all shall be auspicious.

Eulogy states: Travel by land and water is inescapable in this world; ghosts and spirits secretly plot harm. Yet with a single invocation of the Universal Transformation Heavenly Worthy’s name and the wearing of the True King’s Jade Talisman, all shall be well.

The Heavenly Worthy states: When scorching yang prevails and rain is delayed, prostrate yourself before this scripture, and timely sweet rains shall fall. When excessive yin rages and floods overflow, prostrate yourself before this scripture, and skies shall clear. When the Fire God fans disaster and flames engulf homes, when red rats roam the city and the people suffer from heat, this scripture may be used to exorcise them. When the Sea God loses control and fish and turtles wander recklessly, when floods rise to the heavens and the people drown, this scripture may be used to halt them.

Annotation states: This chapter reveals the Heavenly Worthy’s deep compassion for all beings. Prolonged drought or excessive rain arise from the disharmony of heaven and earth’s qi, and the people’s karmic burdens remain unresolved. Thus, the Three Realms grow wrathful: floods and landslides occur, the Fire God fans disaster, red rats stir chaos, and the people know no peace. In such times, one should recite this scripture and burn its talismans; then rain and sunshine shall be timely, and the people shall be at peace.

Exegesis states: When yin and yang lose their rhythm, as in droughts or floods, it stems from the decrees of the celestial bureaus. For the qi of evil karma does not dissipate, and the true Dao is not revered. The Heavenly Worthy, in turning the wheel of creation, nurtures all beings with a heart of boundless life—how can this not be praised?

Exposition states: Clear skies and storms are no small matters. They concern the celestial courts above and the grotto-heavens below, and arise from the disharmony of the two qi. In times of flood or drought, the devout should establish a ritual altar, recite the numinous writ, and burn the jade talismans; then droughts shall yield rain, and rains shall yield sunshine.

Eulogy states: Floods and droughts are disasters that shake heaven and earth. Yet with sincere recitation of the scripture, skies shall clear, and sweet rains shall fall.

The Heavenly Worthy states: Should one wish to avoid the calamities of the three disasters and nine misfortunes, one must prostrate oneself toward the Northern Asterism on a quiet night. Above the Northern Asterism lie the Three Terraces, their stars aligned like paired eyes, stacked in three tiers to cover the Dipper’s bowl—this is called the Celestial Stairway. Whoever beholds them shall be free from imprisonment in life and the sufferings of drowning in death. Within the Dipper resides the August Emperor, two stars as large as chariot wheels. Whoever beholds them shall preserve their form in the world and attain long life as an immortal. Surrendering to this scripture and offering one’s heart to the Northern Culmen shall evoke a response from the unseen.

Annotation states: The Northern Asterism is the North Star. Among the five asterisms, it is the Emperor’s Seat, ever unmoving while all other stars revolve around it. The Northern Dipper resides at heaven’s center, serving as its pivot, turning the four seasons. All matters of heaven and earth, sun and moon, the five planets, the stellar arrays, the six jia, the twenty-eight lodgings, the host of immortals and perfected beings, and the people of the lower realm—from the Son of Heaven to the common folk—whether concerning longevity, wealth, life, death, fortune, misfortune, or the affairs of the unseen, all fall under the Northern Dipper’s governance. The Most High transmitted to Heavenly Master Zhang the *Northern Dipper Scripture’s Oral Instructions*. In times of peril, one should urgently petition the Northern Dipper, pay homage to the True Lord of one’s life-star, and thereby attain peace and safety. One may also attain the Three Terraces’ life-giving, nurturing, and protective blessings. The Three Terraces consist of six stars: the Upper, Middle, and Lower Terraces. The Celestial Stairway is the path by which the Most High ascends and descends, spanning the second star of the Northern Dipper. The Upper Terrace is *Xu Jing*, the Middle Terrace *Liu Chun*, and the Lower Terrace *Qu Sheng*—these are the stars’ inner names. Knowing the stars’ names dispels all evils and brings all virtues to fulfillment. Beholding their forms ensures freedom from imprisonment in life and all sufferings in death. In a quiet chamber, sit upright and visualize the Three Terraces above your head. Then visualize the qi of your two kidneys rising from your chest to connect with the Three Terraces. After prolonged visualization, tap your teeth fourteen times, exhale gently through your nose, close your mouth, and swallow fully. Then recite the incantation:

*"Joint by joint, flourishing and glorious,
I beseech long life.
Great Mysterious Three Terraces,
Ever cover my form.
In all goings and comings,
May the myriad spirits escort my glory."*

After five years of pacing the stars, the immortal bones naturally form. After seven years, all elixirs become refined. After ten years, one ascends to the Celestial Court. *Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the statutes and ordinances.*

One may kowtow in reverent gaze and worship, and all affairs will come to fruition.

Moreover, the Northern Dipper is the spirit and essence of yin and yang. Its radiance illuminates the nine Dao, its light shades the ten heavens—seven manifest, two concealed. Ordinary people see only the seven stars and not the two honorable imperial stars. These two stars are the *Fuxi* and *Bixie*, the August Morning Lords, the majestic spirits of Heaven’s hun-soul and Earth’s po-soul. The *Fu* star governs Heaven and is called *Chang*. The *Bi* star governs Earth and is called *Kong*. *Kong* is the hun-essence of the nine heavens; *Chang* is the po-spirit of the nine earths. When Heaven rests and Earth is at peace, *Kong* and *Chang* remain hidden. When Heaven is in turmoil and Earth is roused, *Kong* and *Chang* shine brilliantly. They transform the myriad qi, alter yin and yang, and govern the succession of the four seasons—nothing occurs without their agency.

These two stars are supremely noble, concealed at dawn’s splendor. Even the nine heavens guard their numinous sounds, keeping them from the world. Only those who attain the Dao—lofty immortals and noble perfected beings—may behold them. Those who pursue fame, chase profit, or wallow in the filth of the vulgar world are not illuminated by their starlight and can scarcely glimpse them. In the past, there have been those who mistakenly saw them. If common folk today mistakenly see them, they must not speak of it. To reveal it is to invite the scourge of war and fire, to suddenly take form and suffer in the earth-prisons of hell, and to bring suffering upon their parents in life and death before the Three Officials.

The method of reverent gazing is as follows: On the third and twenty-seventh nights of each month, without others knowing, secretly go to the central courtyard, burn incense, perform rites, and recite the incantation:

*"Honorable Imperial Two Stars,
Numinous spirits of the Northern Culmen,
May your servant soon behold you,
And upon seeing, attain long life.
Boundless fortune and blessing,
Heaven grants enduring years."*

Sincerely recite this scripture again and again, and in silence, resonance will arise. With time, you will naturally behold them. Yet you must not reveal the name of the Celestial Pivot star, which lies within the Dipper’s hub, its form opposite the *Breaker of Armies* star. This star is slightly larger and reddish. In each double-hour, it follows the Dipper’s handle to illuminate one of the twelve earthly branches, ceaselessly revolving without pause. As the scripture says: *"Where the Celestial Pivot points, day and night it ever turns."*

Thunder’s city is arrayed according to the twelve earthly branches, with twelve gates. When thunder desires to sound, it follows the Celestial Pivot, and the gate toward which it points at that hour is where the sound issues forth. For example, if the Celestial Pivot rests in the *wei* position, pointing toward the *chou* palace, why then does fortune or misfortune arise? The Celestial Pivot is the upright qi—it can give life or take it. Where it points is the life direction, and thus there is life qi. Harnessing it can cure illness, replenish deficiency, calm the spirit, invigorate qi, avert misfortune, dispel calamity, prolong life, and deliver from peril. Where it resides, there is killing qi. Using it can decapitate ghosts, expel demons, suppress violence, restrain brutality, sever poison, and subdue malevolent spirits. Thus, where it points is auspicious; where it resides is inauspicious.

In principle: The nine luminaries and Three Terraces are the sovereigns of the body and the pivot of the myriad phenomena. Scholars should worship and petition them according to the method, and there will be no lack of response.

An explanation: The Three Terrace stars are to be revered and exalted. As for the two honorable imperial stars within the Dipper, what are they? They are the hun-soul of Heaven and the po-soul of Earth, the pivot of creation. Yet Daoist practitioners only know the sincerity of worshipping the perfected and paying homage to the Dipper, without understanding the swift path to gazing upon the two honorable imperial stars. There is also the Celestial Pivot star behind the Northern Dipper, which follows the opening of the thunder gates to point to the twelve gates corresponding to the twelve double-hours. The scriptural meaning is clear: where it points is auspicious; where it resides is inauspicious—that is, the thunder gates. Scholars who wish to pay homage to the Dipper and gaze upon the stars will find the method in the annotations. Beholding them ensures longevity and profound fortune.

An ode:
*The mysteries of the Dark Gate are said to be profound.
When merit and conduct are complete, one pays homage to the nine luminaries.*

The Heavenly Worthy said: In this age of decline, the Dao is faint, and people lack virtue. They are disloyal to their sovereigns, unfilial to their parents, disrespectful to their teachers and elders, unkind to their siblings, unfaithful to their spouses, unrighteous to their friends, unawed by Heaven and Earth, unheeding of the gods, irreverent toward the Three Luminaries, and careless with the Five Grains. They possess three bodily and four oral transgressions: using large scales and small measures, killing living beings and harming lives—one hundred for others, a thousand for themselves—engaging in licentiousness, deceit, rebellion, and treachery. From minor to grave, the Three Officials wield their brushes, the Great Unity sends forth documents, and they are handed over to the Bureau of Five Thunders for execution and investigation. First, their spirits are beheaded; then, their forms are examined. Beheading the spirit and executing the hun-soul leaves them in disarray. They become despised, shunned, resented, and hated by others, until their forms are examined and their corpses shattered, leaving them in ruins. They are driven into rolling waters, forced to pull carts, their monthly orifices inspected every ten days, and subjected to repeated torture.

If one hears this scripture, their sins are immediately erased. Should someone incur the wrath of thunder, their corpse cannot be lifted, and they are not received by water or fire. One should invoke the *Nine Heavens Responding to the Primordial, Thunder’s Voice, Universal Transformation Heavenly Worthy*, and recite this prayer: *"May the myriad spirits bow their heads and heed my command."*

An annotation: If a person commits an offense, they rightfully deserve execution—how could the Thunder Bureau of the Celestial Court strike them down one by one? Those who now suffer punishment by law, perish by the sword, drown in water, or die in fire—all these are deaths by misfortune. For people begin with minor wrongs and, failing to reform, accumulate them day by day and month by month, until they become grave transgressions. Once their sins are manifest and they still do not repent, the Three Officials and the Great Unity examine and record them, sending documents to the Five Thunders’ Bureau, which first beheads their spirits and hun-souls. When the appointed time arrives, the punishment is carried out, and their dead souls are then subjected to the Thunder Bureau’s driving, beating, and torture.

If one reforms, turns toward goodness, and surrenders to this scripture, their sins are immediately erased. If a man or woman incurs the wrath of thunder, and their headdress, hair, or beard is not singed, they may appeal to the Heavenly Worthy and seek divine judgment, for the myriad spirits will heed their command.

The Exposition states: The Three Bonds and Five Constants are principles immutable through the ages—how could one dare defy them with reckless conduct? Grain is the people’s life and the nation’s treasure—how could it not be cherished and protected? In recent times, shallowness prevails: loyalty and filial piety are abandoned, righteousness and benevolence forsaken. Extravagance is exalted while frugality is despised; morality is scorned while deceit is practiced. Such governance invites calamity upon calamity. Why not reflect? The Heavenly Worthy has graciously opened the great path—one should tread and follow it, and all evils shall cease to arise.

The Exegesis states: Born between Heaven and Earth, humans receive the two qi and embody the Five Constants. Walking the path of benevolence and righteousness, upholding loyalty and filial piety—why then indulge in reckless disregard for life and commit all manner of unprincipled acts? In grave cases, the Thunder Bureau vents its wrath, exposing corpses in the marketplace; in lesser ones, the courts impose punishment upon the body. Thus, goodness may be practiced, but evil must not be committed. The Thunder Bureau drives and enslaves the unrighteous, while those who cultivate virtue are naturally preserved and delivered. Should one invoke the name of the Heavenly Worthy, all spirits will bow and heed their command.

The Eulogy states:
Loyalty and filial piety form the foundation,
Yin and yang are my true home.
To dissolve all karmic misdeeds,
One need not recite the *Nanhua*.

The Heavenly Worthy declares: The merit of this scripture is inconceivable. In kalpas past, the Divine King of Jade Purity of the Divine Empyrean, the Great Emperor of Long Life, once proclaimed it. Those of noble virtue who transmit this scripture must offer gold and silk as tokens, swearing oaths to Heaven before passing it on.

The Thunder Master Haoxi, rising from his long prostration, reverently addressed the Heavenly Worthy: Wherever this scripture resides, the Earth Deities and Life Mandates shall guard and protect it, while the Thunder Bureau shall descend to inspect and examine in due time. If a household enshrines this scripture with utmost sincerity, auspicious mist will fill its courtyard, propitious clouds will shade its halls, misfortunes will not arise, and blessings will gather. Upon death, they shall not pass through hell. Why is this so? At death, they are reborn; in life, they return to the good Dao, inheriting the Heavenly Worthy’s power and attaining this spiritual efficacy. Carrying this scripture in daily life, all people will revere them, and ghosts and spirits will stand in awe. When encountering peril, wholeheartedly invoking the name of the Nine Heavens’ Responsive Primordial Thunder Voice Universal Transformation Heavenly Worthy will ensure deliverance from all dangers.

The Annotation states: The Heavenly Worthy, moved by great compassion, expounded this precious scripture to benefit the heavens above and deliver all beings below. Those of noble virtue who receive it must offer gold and silk as tokens to affirm their sincerity, swearing oaths to the Ten Heavens before transmission. The gold and silk serve only to bind the heart in oath to Heaven—quantity is not the measure. Though the offerings be modest, the covenant is weighty. The Great Sage does not withhold this scripture out of stinginess but fears that people might treat it lightly; thus, He earnestly instructs. The Thunder Master should command the Earth Deities and Life Mandates to guard and protect it everywhere. If one serves the Heavenly Worthy, reciting the scripture’s name with devotion, the divine perfected will descend to their courtyard, and auspicious clouds will swirl. Those who uphold the true teachings in life shall, in death, return to the good Dao. Further, if one transcribes this scripture according to the prescribed talismanic forms, carries it with utmost sincerity, no calamities will arise, and both humans and spirits will revere and stand in awe.

The Exposition states: The intent of this chapter is to inspire sincere faith without deceit. Later scholars and gentlemen should follow the scripture’s teachings, and they shall not err.

The Exegesis states: The Thunder Master Haoxi, bowing in reverence to the Heavenly Worthy’s supreme transformation, was overcome with joy. Rising from his long prostration, he again addressed the Heavenly Worthy: From this day forward, those of noble virtue who receive this scripture must pledge their hearts with gold and silk before transmitting its text. Wherever this scripture resides, the Earth Deities and Life Mandates shall guard and protect it, while the Thunder Bureau shall descend to inspect and examine in due time. Those who recite and uphold it shall bring blessings to their households and enable their ancestors to ascend. Those who carry it will be revered by all, feared by ghosts and spirits, and upon encountering danger, invoking the Heavenly Worthy’s name will ensure deliverance. Thus, the merit of this scripture is truly inconceivable.

The Eulogy states:
Not gold but a sincere heart is prized,
For the beginning adept, external demons assail.
If one is willing to swear oaths to Heaven and Earth,
Swiftly shall you hear the jade tones of the Dao.

Then the Thunder Master Haoxi, before the Heavenly Worthy, spoke this gatha:
Supreme Jade Purity King,
Ruler of the thirty-six heavens.
Nine Heavens’ Universal Transformation Lord,
Manifesting forms across the ten directions.
With unbound hair riding a qilin,
Barefoot treading layered ice.
Holding the qi of the Nine Heavens,
Whistling winds, lashing thunder.
With the power of wisdom,
Subduing all demonic spirits.
Delivering souls from eternal night,
Benefiting all beings.
Like the silver river’s waters,
A thousand eyes, a thousand moon wheels.
Vowing in future kalpas,
To eternally exalt the Heavenly Worthy’s reverence.

When the Thunder Master Haoxi finished this gatha,

The Annotation states: In this chapter, the Thunder Master Haoxi, suddenly enlightened, spoke this gatha to extol even a fraction of the Heavenly Worthy’s great virtue of cherishing life. Its literary grace flows brightly, its language resplendent—its merit and power defy description.

The Exposition states: The virtue of the Heavenly Worthy is beyond comprehension; thus, the Thunder Master Haoxi likened it to the Silver River. He spoke of the Heavenly Worthy’s primordial qi as supremely pure, noble, sagely, and luminous.

The Exegesis states: The Thunder Master Haoxi, his heart humbled by the divine efficacy, could find no words of praise sufficient. Thus, he composed this gatha. Our Heavenly Worthy, sovereign of the thirty-six heavens, transforms the vastness of the ten directions. When traversing the heavens, He rides a qilin with unbound indigo hair. When breaking through the Nine Springs, He treads layered ice with bare feet. "Holding the qi of the Nine Heavens" refers to the golden radiance of His ruyi scepter. Whistling winds and lashing thunder are the Heavenly Worthy’s commands. Slaying demons, expelling evil, delivering beings, and benefiting humanity—this is the Heavenly Worthy’s work of benefiting all beings. The waters of the Silver River are unseen by mortals, unfathomable in their mystery. "A thousand eyes, a thousand moon wheels" means that those who return to the teachings shall feel as though the Heavenly Worthy is ever before them.

Vowing with boundless resolve, they shall forever propagate the teachings of the Heavenly Worthy.

Praise:
We extol the Heavenly Worthy—truly, this gatha is sincere.
Universally transforming without limit, from the primordial kalpas, one qi.

The Heavenly Worthy declares: This scripture has been transmitted through the world, yet mortals remain unaware. Now, the Nine Heavens’ Responding-to-the-Primordial Palace, which I govern, is served by the Nine Heavens’ Thunder Gate Envoys, assisted by the Recorders of Slanted Records and the Inspectors of Integrity. There are also four bureaus: the first is the Bureau of Surplus Seizures, the second the Bureau of Accumulated Arrests, the third the Bureau of Hidden Grievances, and the fourth the Bureau of Karmic Retribution. Each is overseen by a Grand Minister to manage its affairs. All whom I govern—ministers, masters, and envoys—all praise the primordial transformation.

Annotation:
The Heavenly Worthy speaks of the officials, soldiers, generals, and scribes under His governance, assigning each to their duties of good and evil. Thus, the pivot of life and death lies entirely in the Heavenly Worthy’s commands; the myriad spirits of the Three Realms all obey without exception.

Exegesis:
This chapter reveals that the Heavenly Worthy assigns each good and evil deed to its respective office, all of which praise and fulfill the primordial transformation.

Exposition:
This chapter concludes the scripture’s discourse, anticipating that later scholars may not know the offices under the Heavenly Worthy’s governance. Thus, they are listed here. For all prayers and petitions, the officials, officers, generals, and soldiers, upon hearing the Heavenly Worthy’s commands, all praise and fulfill the primordial transformation.

Praise:
Offices established, duties divided to wield thunder and lightning,
Wind and fire soar, commands resound with clarity.
Rewarding good and punishing evil as swiftly as shadow follows form—
The Nine Heavens’ Primordial never bends to mortal whim.

When the Heavenly Worthy finished expounding this scripture, a seven-jeweled jade terrace of layered tiers appeared, celestial blossoms scattered in profusion, and fragrant jade incense curled in the air. The Heavenly Sovereigns of the ten directions all proclaimed, "Excellent indeed!" The dragon deities, ghostly spirits, thunder officials, and the myriad beings of the Three Realms all rejoiced greatly, faithfully receiving and upholding the teachings.

Annotation:
Once the scripture was expounded, the Heavenly Sovereigns and thunder officials, along with all ghostly spirits, praised it with exultation before departing. All of like mind—devout believers and virtuous people—who encounter this precious scripture should purify their hearts and cleanse their thoughts, reciting the true text with utmost sincerity. Thus, calamities shall not arise, and eternal longevity shall be preserved.

Exegesis:
Proclaiming the scripture and praising the transformation, the Three Realms and ten directions all attain their desires. Scholars who encounter this precious scripture and jade talismans should purify their hearts, cleanse their thoughts, offer water and flowers, and recite and inscribe them according to the proper method. Then, no misfortunes shall arise, and all virtues shall converge.

Now, those of noble intent align their hearts with Heaven’s will, purify their own minds, peruse the true text, and compose the mysterious script. How can they not devote themselves wholeheartedly to upholding it, thereby magnifying its transformation?

Exposition:
This precious scripture and jade talismans could not have been bestowed upon the world to transform sentient beings without the decree of the Three Pure Realms’ supreme境 and the command of the Jade Pure True King. Now, the scripture’s purport has been collated and corrected, its annotations made clear; the jade talismans and golden chapters shine brilliantly. How can those who seek divine aid not purify their hearts and cleanse themselves to study the mysterious script?

The noble adept, Dao-ling, holds the office of Capital Merit, serving in the Left Academy. Employing his own spirit and primordial qi, he binds them into radiant accomplishment. On this day, the Heavenly Worthy’s virtue of universal transformation is perfected in scripture, arrayed to the left of the sagely and true. Those who recite this scripture must not treat it with irreverence—great offenses invite heavenly punishment, while lesser ones bring misfortune.

Praise:
The precious scripture is complete—all proclaim, "Excellent indeed!"
Disasters are dispelled, sins absolved; misfortunes depart, blessings arrive.
The *Jade Pivot Precious Scripture of the Nine Heavens’ Responding-to-the-Primordial, Thunder Voice, Universal Transformation Heavenly Worthy*, with Collected Annotations, concludes here.

Perfect and Auspicious Mystic Chapter:
From the outset of reciting the scripture, thought after thought, maintain sincerity.
A thousand truths bow in attendance; ten thousand sages commune in spirit.
Responding to the Primordial, merging with the formless,
The Nine Heavens issue their decree; the Three Realms comply.
Dispelling disasters, repenting transgressions,
Praying for blessings, prolonging life.
When merit is complete and conduct fulfilled,
The Great Dao bears witness.

Talismans:
Whenever inscribing a talisman, one should burn incense and arouse profound reverence, reciting with utmost sincerity from the beginning of the main scripture through the three chapters, including the chapter for one’s petition. Then, visualize the Heavenly Worthy’s precious form, recite the Heavenly Sovereign’s divine incantation, and inscribe it. At all times, protect the talisman with yellow paper. When using it, unfold it accordingly. The same applies to all subsequent talismanic texts.

Chapter One: Cultivating the Dao to Seek Immortality
Chapter Two: Summoning the Nine Numinous and Three Essences
On one’s natal day, observe strict purification rites, recite the scripture, invoke the titles, inscribe the talisman, and burn it.

Chapter Three: Resolving the Five Phases’ and Nine Luminaries’ Clashes and Conflicts
Chapter Four: Curing Chronic Illnesses, Curses, and Karmic Entanglements
Chapter Five: Dispelling Gossip and Slander
Chapter Six: Warding Off the Supreme August Spirits’ Calamities and Taboos
Chapter Seven: Praying for Offspring, Protecting Childbirth, and Safeguarding Infants
Chapter Eight: Eliminating Raven Demons and Serpent Afflictions
Chapter Nine: Dispelling Malevolent Spirits, Eradicating Demons, and Destroying Sorcerous Hexes
Chapter Ten: Dissolving Gu Poisons and Liberating Ancestral Spirits
Chapter Eleven: Safe Journeys on Water and Land
Chapter Twelve: Praying for Rain, Seeking Clear Skies, and Averting Water and Fire Disasters
Chapter Thirteen: Worshiping the Stars and Paying Homage to the Dipper
Chapter Fourteen: Hearing the Scripture and Eradicating Sins
Chapter Fifteen: Wearing the Talisman to Accumulate Blessings, Commanding Human Respect, and Instilling Ghostly Fear

Continuation of Marriage Talismans:
Whenever infants are in swaddling clothes, they may be afflicted by the fifteen kinds of ghosts under the Sandalwood Spirit King, causing frequent convulsions. It is fitting to recite this scripture.

According to the *Sutra for Protecting All Children* in the Buddhist Canon, the Sandalwood Spirit King’s fifteen ghostly forms roam the world, terrifying infants and young children with various frightening appearances. Those who sincerely recite the scripture and burn the talisman shall avoid this calamity.

First: The Mijiuqia Ghost, shaped like an ox, possessing children and causing their eyes to roll.
Second: The Mijiawang Ghost, shaped like a lion, possessing children and causing repeated vomiting.
Third: The Qiantuo, shaped like the Kumāra Deva, frightening children and making their shoulders twitch.
Fourth: The Aboximoluo, shaped like a wild fox, possessing children and causing foam to issue from their mouths.

Fifth: The Muzhijia, shaped like a macaque, possessing children and causing their fists to clench without release.
Sixth: The Mozhijia, shaped like a rākṣasī woman, possessing children and causing them to bite their own tongues.
Seventh: The Yanmijia, shaped like a horse, possessing children and making them prone to weeping and laughter.
Eighth: The Jiamini, shaped like a woman, possessing children and causing them to delight in women.
Ninth: The Libodi, shaped like a dog, possessing children and manifesting various miscellaneous forms.
Tenth: The Fuduna, shaped like a boar, possessing children and causing them to startle in fright and weep while asleep.
Eleventh: The Mandonanti, shaped like a cat, possessing children and making them prone to weeping and laughter in their sleep.
Twelfth: The Shejiuni, shaped like a crow, possessing children and causing them to refuse milk.
Thirteenth: The Jianzhaboni, shaped like a chicken, possessing children and causing their throats to become obstructed.
Fourteenth: The Muqumancha, shaped like a black fox, possessing children and afflicting them with seasonal febrile illnesses and dysentery.
Fifteenth: The Lanpo, shaped like a snake, possessing children and causing them to hiccup and cry out repeatedly.

The *Thunder and Lightning Jade Scripture* encountered by Master Xuanyang is thus in its entirety, and thus it must have its origins. Rather than keeping it secret, he has now resolved to print and disseminate it widely, demonstrating his profound aspiration to benefit others. Though I have not met the man, I have already come to know his heart, and I recognize that he is no ordinary person.

Yet the supreme Dao is wordless, and the most profound teachings leave no trace. Their spiritual illumination and clarity depend upon the individual. You have already gained insight through written words, but by extending this effort, you may yet attain understanding beyond them. Far better that others should call you one who clings to mere images and texts—this is my deepest hope for you. Strive onward.

Written on the fifteenth day of the first lunar month in the *guiyou* year of the Zhishun era, by the thirty-ninth-generation Celestial Master, Taixuanzi.

chunks.original_text: 九天应元雷声普化天尊玉枢宝经集注 经名：九天应元雷声普化天尊玉枢宝经集注。 海琼白真人注、祖天师张真君解义、五雷使者张天君释、纯阳子孚佑帝君赞。 二卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞真部玉诀类。 九天应元雷声普化天尊玉枢宝经集注上 注曰：九者，阳数也，乃天道也。 主於震宫，故东南有九无之说也，即雷师出入之地也。 天者，至大至圣无极无为之炁也。 应者，无物不承天命而生也。 元者，至大也。 又曰万善之长也，乃四时之首也，五行之先也。 雷者，乃天令也。 掌生生杀杀之权，动静人莫可测万神之奉行也。 声者，生也，万物得雷震声而萌也。 又曰天不言以雷代言也。 普者，上天下地四维八荒无形有形也。 化者，天道阴阳运行则为化。 又自无而有自有而无则为化万物生息则为化。 老子云：我无为而民自化。 又云以德化是也。 天尊者，至大至贵之称也。 说者，赞扬也，阐教也，解隐释奥也。 玉者，天地日月之精华，阴阳水火之结秀也。 润而温，宝而贵，万载之不可朽灭也。 枢者，机也，轴也，乃生杀之始由也。 宝者，珍重也。 经者，径也，乃修真入道之要路也。 义曰：斯经以玉枢而名者，乃天地之消息，阴阳之动静也。 元数乃乾元用九之说，而普化天尊居其上，为三界之尊十方之灵明矣。 释曰：天尊发愿广大，化及群生，其德不可量而机不可测也。 故以雷声代化，玉枢为衡，则善善恶恶杀杀生生皆听於九炁之真王。 所以，三界万灵，十方诸天，莫不皆赞我天尊之元化也。 赞曰：祖炁氤氲满太虚，九天元是九天居。 驱雷役雨飞金篆，活物生人备玉枢。 三界有情同得道，十方无路不通车。 大哉普化明元始，日月齐光信不诬。 尔时九天应元雷声普化天尊， 注曰：九天者，乃统三十六天总司也。 始因东南九炁而生，正出雷门，所以掌三十六雷之令，受诸司府院之印，生善杀恶，不顺人情。 盖以九天之名者，取其阳刚而不泯者之谓也。 应元者，仰惟元始祖劫一炁分真，玉清真王应元之体。 雷者，阴阳二炁结而成雷，既有雷霆，遂分部隶九天雷祖。 因之以剖析为五属，神霄真王用之，以宰御三界。 真王所居神霄玉府，其道在乎巽。 巽者，天　　中之地也，东南乃九阳之炁。 结清朗光，元始父祖，化神霄玉清真王。 玉府在碧霄梵炁之中，去雷城二千三百里。 雷城高八十一丈，左有玉枢五雷使院，右有玉府五雷使院。 天有四方四隅，分为九霄，惟此一霄居於梵炁之中。 在心曰神，故曰神霄，乃真王按治之所。 天尊临莅之都。 卿师使相，列职分司，主天之灾福，持物之权衡，掌物掌人，司生司杀，检押启闭，管钥生成。 上自天皇，下自地帝，非雷霆无以行其令。 大而生死，小而枯荣，非雷霆无以主其政。 雷霆政令，其所隶焉，三清上圣雷霆祖也，十极至尊雷霆本也，昊天玉皇上帝号令雷霆也，后土皇地祇节制雷霆也，北极紫微大帝掌握五雷也。 五雷者，天雷，地雷，水雷，龙雷，社令雷。 又有十雷：一曰玉枢雷，二曰神霄雷，三曰大洞雷，四曰仙都雷，五日北极雷，六曰太乙雷，七曰紫府雷，八曰玉晨雷j 九曰太霄雷，十曰太极雷。 又有三十六雷：一曰玉枢雷，二曰玉府雷，三曰玉柱雷，四曰上清大洞雷，五曰火轮雷，六曰灌斗雷，七曰风火雷，八曰飞捷雷，九曰北极雷，十曰紫微璇枢雷，十一曰神霄雷，十二曰仙都雷，十三曰太乙轰天雷，十四曰紫府雷，十五曰铁甲雷，十六曰邵阳雷，十七曰欻火雷，十八社令蛮雷，十九曰地祇呜雷，二十曰三界雷，二十一曰斩圹雷，二十二曰大威雷，二十三曰六波雷，二十四曰青草雷，二十五曰八卦雷，二十六曰混元鹰犬雷，二十七日啸命风雷，二十八曰火云雷，二十九日禹步大统摄雷，三十曰太极雷，三十一曰剑火雷。

### *The Jade Pivot Precious Scripture of the Nine Heavens Responsive Primordial Thunder-Sound Universal Transformation Heavenly Worthy: Collected Commentaries, Fascicle One*

**Commentary states:**
Nine is the yang number, the Dao of Heaven. It governs the *Zhen* Palace, hence the saying of the "Nine Voids" in the southeast—this is the realm where the Thunder Master enters and departs. Heaven is the supreme, sagely, boundless, and non-acting *qi*. "Responsive" means all things receive Heaven’s mandate to be born. "Primordial" is the greatest, the chief of all virtues, the first of the four seasons, and the origin of the Five Agents. Thunder is Heaven’s decree, wielding the power of generation and destruction. Its movements are unfathomable, and the myriad spirits obey its commands. "Sound" is life—all things sprout upon hearing the thunder’s roar. It is also said that Heaven does not speak but uses thunder as its voice. "Universal" encompasses the four directions, the eight wilds, the formless and the formed. "Transformation" is the operation of Heaven’s Dao through yin and yang. It is the shift from non-being to being, from being to non-being, the birth and decay of the myriad things. Laozi said: "I practice non-action, and the people transform of themselves." He also said: "This is the transformation through virtue." "Heavenly Worthy" is the most exalted and noble title. "Scripture" is praise, the propagation of teachings, the elucidation of mysteries. "Jade" is the essence of Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, the congealed splendor of yin-yang and water-fire. It is moistening and warm, precious and noble, imperishable for ten thousand generations. "Pivot" is the mechanism, the axle—the origin of life and death. "Precious" means revered. "Scripture" is the path, the essential road to cultivating perfection and entering the Dao.

**Exegesis states:**
This scripture is named for the *Jade Pivot* because it embodies the ebb and flow of Heaven and Earth, the movement and stillness of yin and yang. The primordial number is the *Qian* trigram’s "use of nine," and the Universal Transformation Heavenly Worthy presides above, supreme among the Three Realms and luminous across the Ten Directions.

**Exposition states:**
The Heavenly Worthy’s vows are vast, transforming all living beings. His virtue is immeasurable, his mechanism unfathomable. Thus, he employs thunder’s sound for transformation and the jade pivot as the balance. Good and evil, killing and generation—all are governed by the True King of the Nine *Qi*. Therefore, the myriad spirits of the Three Realms and the deities of the Ten Directions all praise the Heavenly Worthy’s primordial transformation.

**Eulogy states:**
The primordial *qi* suffuses the Great Void,
The Nine Heavens are truly the Nine Heavens’ abode.
Commanding thunder and dispatching rain, golden talismans take flight,
Reviving creatures and nurturing life, the jade pivot is complete.
All sentient beings in the Three Realms attain the Dao,
No path in the Ten Directions is impassable.
Great is the Universal Transformation, radiant in primordial beginning—
Sun and moon shine equally, this is no falsehood.

---

**At that time, the Nine Heavens Responsive Primordial Thunder-Sound Universal Transformation Heavenly Worthy...**

**Commentary states:**
The Nine Heavens govern the thirty-six heavens collectively. Originating from the nine *qi* of the southeast, they emerge from the Thunder Gate, thus presiding over the thirty-six thunder commands. They receive the seals of all bureaus, courts, and halls, generating good and destroying evil without regard for human sentiment. The name "Nine Heavens" signifies their yang vigor, which does not perish. "Responsive Primordial" reveres the primordial beginning of the ancestral kalpa, when the One *Qi* divided into the true forms, and the Jade Clarity True King embodied the responsive primordial essence. Thunder arises from the conjoining of yin and yang *qi*. With the advent of thunder and lightning, the Nine Heavens Thunder Ancestor divided their jurisdiction. These were further subdivided into five attributes, employed by the Divine Empyrean True King to govern the Three Realms. The True King resides in the Divine Empyrean Jade Palace, whose Dao lies in *Xun*. *Xun* is the earth within Heaven, the southeast being the realm of the nine yang *qi*. Congealing into luminous clarity, the Primordial Father and Ancestor transformed into the Divine Empyrean Jade Clarity True King. The Jade Palace lies within the azure empyrean’s Brahma *qi*, two thousand three hundred *li* from the Thunder City. The Thunder City stands eighty-one *zhang* high, with the Jade Pivot Five-Thunder Envoy Court to its left and the Jade Palace Five-Thunder Envoy Court to its right. Heaven has four directions and four corners, divided into the Nine Empyreans. Only this one empyrean dwells within the Brahma *qi*. That which is in the heart is called *shen*, hence the name *Divine Empyrean*—the True King’s seat of governance, the Heavenly Worthy’s capital. Ministers, teachers, envoys, and officials are arrayed in offices, governing Heaven’s calamities and blessings, holding the balance of things, overseeing life and death, inspecting and sealing, managing the keys of generation. From the Heavenly Sovereign above to the Earthly Emperor below, none can issue decrees without thunder. From life and death to withering and flourishing, none can administer governance without thunder. Thunder’s governance and commands are subordinate to the Three Clarities’ Sagely Thunder Ancestor, the Ten Poles’ Supreme Thunder Origin, the August Jade Emperor of the Vast Heaven who issues thunder’s decrees, the Queen of Earth who regulates thunder, and the Northern Culmen Purple Tenuity Great Emperor who wields the Five Thunders.

chunks.original_text: 三十二曰内鉴雷，三十三曰外镒雷，三十四曰神府天枢雷，三十五曰大梵斗枢雷，三十六曰玉晨雷。 有三十六神曩，尝陈之於太上之前。 雷法有七十二阶，天地赏善罚恶发生万物皆雷也。 虽阴阳之激剥，亦由神人之兴动，雷呜则雨降矣。 声者，天地之仁声也。 春分五日，雷乃发声，可闻百里，震九天而动九地，惊四海而翻四溟，太上曰：吾不发阴阳之声，吾之大音无以召，故鼓之以雷霆，以声召气也。 雷帝之前，有雷鼓三十六面。 凡行雷之时，雷帝亲击本部雷鼓一下，即时雷公雷神兴发雷声也。 普化天尊者，自浮黎元始天尊生九子，玉清真王化生雷声普化天尊。 天尊以历劫应化，随时示号。 本元始祖劫一炁分真，乃玉清真王，九霄主宰。 一月四辰监观万天，浮游三界九州万国，赏善录愆，是为普化至大至贵也。 义曰：九天虽曰乾数，阳刚而不柔实乃九炁之生处也。 於是结英聚灵，成我玉清真王之化形也。 应元者，天地一炁，阴阳五行，上布下流，无一物不承天命，而得阴阳之炁以所生也。 故曰应元，又何疑矣。 雷之为雷大矣哉，故三界十方天圣地真各有司焉，惟九天玉清真王总治其令也。 声乃炁之用，炁乃声之令，明是辩非，震萌起垫，非雷之令，何 能生也。 普化天尊者，天即我，我即天，发愿广大，化形十方凡诸众生能皈心向道，我当以身身之，非天尊普化而何？ 释曰：是时九炁成形，结为九天，在三十六天之上，十方三界之祖炁也。 所以用九之故，其炁元本乎三清之体，而用乎九天之名宜矣。 应元者，天阳地阴理之然也。 盖我天尊，生乎阳而居於天，其健而刚也。 所以万物生乎地，莫不皆听命於天尊，使物物各得其宜。 世人不知其故，而本元皆出乎天尊之余炁也。 天尊欲人人皆为天尊者，何故惜其炁而应其本元之妙道也。 雷者，类也，是以出万类而起群品也。 孰不知，雷乃阴阳二炁之激剥，却有所司。 馘恶诛邪驱风役雨者何耶？ 凡俗无知，岂识元始生杀之机玉清真王之妙用也。 声者，令也，听也。 天无声则雷霆不行，地无声则草木不萌，人无声则清浊难明。 所以声为一身之本，乃阴阳之元黑也。 天无私，日月垂明。 天有德，人物俱生。 是故我天尊代天行道，德施三界，使清者为圣，浊者为贤。 凡诸有情有形者，俾跻仙阼，共成一炁。 赞曰：九天九天，玄之又玄。 忽尔我后，焂焉我前。 右九天。 二炁虽分阴与阳，玉清高处化真王。 上天下地能相合，阐教分形遍十方。 右应元。 二炁之正，五行之令。 斩鬼诛邪，天人响应。 右雷。 广宣帝德起群生，三界英灵侧耳听。 莫道老天无一语，须知司令有雷呜。 右声。 好生之德不能量，阐教诸天及十方。 高处玉清治雷府，万神朝服礼真王。 右普化。 在玉清天中，与十方诸天帝君，会於玉虚九光之殿，郁萧弥罗之馆，紫极曲密之房。 阅太幽碧瑶之笈，考洞微明晨之书，交头接耳，细议重玄，诸多陪臣左右踧踖。 天尊宴坐，朗诵洞章。 诸天帝君，长吟步虚。 彩女仙妹，散花旋绕，复相引领，游戏翠宫。 群仙导前，先节后铁，龙旅鸾辖，飘讽太空，并集於玉梵七宝层台。 注曰：在者其时也，天尊游於玉清天中，与十方诸天帝君，宴会於玉虚殿馆紫极之房。

There are thirty-six thunder spirits of old, once arrayed before the Most High. The thunder methods comprise seventy-two ranks, for the heavens and earth reward good and punish evil, and all things arise through thunder. Though it be the clash of yin and yang, it is also the stirring of divine and human agency—when thunder roars, rain descends.

Sound is the benevolent voice of heaven and earth. At the spring equinox, five days later, thunder’s voice arises, audible for a hundred leagues, shaking the nine heavens and stirring the nine earths, startling the four seas and churning the four abysses. The Most High said: “Were I not to emit the sound of yin and yang, my great tone would have no means of summoning. Thus I drum forth with thunder and lightning to call forth qi with sound.”

Before the Thunder Thearch stand thirty-six thunder drums. Whenever thunder is to be deployed, the Thunder Thearch personally strikes the drum of his own division once, and immediately the thunder lords and thunder spirits unleash their thunderous voices.

The Vast Transformation Heavenly Worthy was born of the nine sons of the Primordial Heavenly Worthy of Floating Radiance. The Jade Clarity Perfected King transformed and gave rise to the Thunder Voice Vast Transformation Heavenly Worthy. Through kalpas of responsive manifestation, the Heavenly Worthy assumes titles in accord with the times. From the original qi of the Primordial Ancestral Kalpa, the qi divided and became perfected, giving rise to the Jade Clarity Perfected King, sovereign of the nine empyreans. For one month and four celestial markers, he oversees the myriad heavens, roaming the three realms and the nine provinces of the ten thousand lands, rewarding good and recording transgressions—such is the Vast Transformation, most great and most noble.

In principle: Though the nine heavens are said to be the number of qian, yang and firm, yet not yielding, they are in truth the birthplace of the nine qi. Therein, essence gathers and spirit congeals, forming the transformed body of our Jade Clarity Perfected King.

Responsive Origin: The qi of heaven and earth, the yin and yang of the five phases, flow above and below—there is not a single thing that does not receive the mandate of heaven and obtain the qi of yin and yang by which it is born. Thus it is called Responsive Origin—what doubt could there be?

Great indeed is thunder! Therefore, the celestial sages and earthly perfected of the three realms and ten directions each have their offices, yet the Jade Clarity Perfected King of the nine heavens governs all their commands.

Sound is the function of qi; qi is the command of sound. It clarifies right and wrong, shakes the sprouting and raises the submerged—without the command of thunder, how could life arise?

The Vast Transformation Heavenly Worthy: Heaven is I, I am heaven. With vast and boundless vows, I transform my body throughout the ten directions. For all sentient beings who turn their hearts toward the Dao, I shall embody them in body—what else is this if not the Vast Transformation of the Heavenly Worthy?

Explanation: At that time, the nine qi took form and coalesced into the nine heavens, above the thirty-six heavens, the ancestral qi of the ten directions and three realms. The reason for employing the number nine is that its qi fundamentally arises from the body of the Three Clarities, and its use of the name of the nine heavens is fitting.

Responsive Origin: It is the principle of heaven as yang and earth as yin. Now, our Heavenly Worthy is born of yang and dwells in heaven, firm and unyielding. Thus all things born of earth without exception heed the command of the Heavenly Worthy, so that each thing attains its proper place. Worldly people do not understand this principle, yet their original essence all derives from the surplus qi of the Heavenly Worthy. The Heavenly Worthy desires that all people become Heavenly Worthies—why would he begrudge his qi and not respond to the wondrous Dao of their original essence?

Thunder is of a kind, giving rise to the myriad kinds and arousing the multitude of species. Who does not know that thunder is the clash of yin and yang qi, yet it has its overseers? Why does it sever evil, punish perversity, drive winds, and dispatch rain? The common folk, lacking understanding, how could they recognize the mechanism of life and death of the Primordial Beginning or the wondrous function of the Jade Clarity Perfected King?

Sound is command, it is hearing. Without sound, heaven’s thunder and lightning would not move; without sound, earth’s grasses and trees would not sprout; without sound, humans could not distinguish purity from turbidity. Thus sound is the root of the self, the primordial darkness of yin and yang.

Heaven is impartial—sun and moon shed their light. Heaven has virtue—all beings are born. Therefore, our Heavenly Worthy acts on heaven’s behalf to enact the Dao, bestowing virtue upon the three realms, so that the pure become sages and the turbid become worthies. For all sentient and formed beings, he enables them to ascend to the immortal ranks and together complete the one qi.

Eulogy:
Nine heavens, nine heavens,
Mysterious, again mysterious.
Suddenly behind me,
In an instant before me.
Right: Nine Heavens.

Though the two qi divide into yin and yang,
The Jade Clarity soars high, transforming the Perfected King.
Above heaven, below earth, they harmonize,
Spreading teachings and dividing forms throughout the ten directions.
Right: Responsive Origin.

The rectitude of the two qi,
The command of the five phases.
Severing demons, punishing perversity,
Heaven and humans respond in echo.
Right: Thunder.

Broadly proclaiming the Thearch’s virtue to arouse the multitude of beings,
The heroic spirits of the three realms incline their ears to listen.
Do not say that old heaven is silent,
For you must know the command is in the thunder’s roar.
Right: Sound.

The virtue of cherishing life cannot be measured,
The teachings spread through all heavens and the ten directions.
High in Jade Clarity, governing the Thunder Bureau,
The myriad spirits in court robes pay homage to the Perfected King.
Right: Vast Transformation.

Within the Heaven of Jade Clarity, together with the Heavenly Lords of the ten directions, they gather in the Palace of Jade Void and Ninefold Radiance, the Hall of Lush Mist and Expansive Net, the Chamber of Purple Ultimate and Hidden Depths. They peruse the azure-green jade tablets of the Profound Darkness, examine the books of the Luminous Dawn of the Subtle Cavern, whispering intimately of the profound mystery, with many attendant ministers standing respectfully by.

The Heavenly Worthy sits in tranquil repose, reciting the cavern scriptures. The Heavenly Lords of the ten directions chant the "Pacing the Void." Jade maidens and immortal sisters scatter flowers in circling dance, then lead one another to wander and play in the Emerald Palace. The host of immortals guides the way, with pennants preceding and iron staves following, dragon banners and simurgh chariots soaring through the vast sky, all assembling at the Seven-Treasured Tiered Terrace of Jade Brahmā.

chunks.original_text: 是时，天尊检观太幽碧瑶之箱，稽考洞微明晨之纪。 交头接耳者，盖诸天帝君列坐有次，圣圣相传，共听微密玄玄之言。 彼时诸天帝君，亦各有众多家臣，左右踧踖，恭馑侍焉。 天尊安然高座，朗诵洞章。 诸天帝君深有所悟，各各起座长吟，步虚赞咏天尊之教。 彩女仙妹，散花盘绕於天尊之座，复请天尊往诣翠宫之七宝层台，欲望天尊大演妙法也。 层台即龙凤之座，有七级，皆珍宝饰之，故名七宝层台。 天尊驾兴，白鹤师子，威仪节仗，引导其前。 青龙白虎，六甲六丁，侍卫左右。 九天仙女，十二溪真，陈奏仙乐。 诸天大帝，神君神王，太极真人，副从凤笔龙舆，经游翠宫。 仙仗节钺，龙旗鸾辂，飘飘太空，集聚宝台。 义曰：是时，游玉清，驻宝台，大阐玄文，广宣要语。 天人左右，皆得开心受化，而功行又崇也。 释曰：是时，我天尊在自居之阙，阙中有九光之殿馆阁房位，阅法考书，欲化十方天真帝君，明其大道。 於是天真帝君被德服膺，不知舞蹈。 天尊大悦，欲游外官，诸天韦仙，左右前后，仗钺排旗，引我天尊驻鸾辂於翠宫。 翠宫者，玉清之行宫也。 雷师心怀奏，疑无由以陈。 幸值我天尊登宝台，手举金光明之如意，俯察万类。 赞曰：故把玄，玄一窍开，十方三界应时来。 琼书细阅存元炁，宝笈重宣养本胎。 侍女交头心自会，陪臣踧踖意能裁。 须突演教天花舞，鸾凤飘飘七宝台。 时有雷师皓翁，於仙众中越班而出，面天尊前，俯颤作礼，勃变长跪，上白天尊言：天尊大慈，天尊大圣，为群生父，为万灵师。 今者诸天，咸此良觌，适见天尊阅宝笈，考琼书，於中秘颐，不可缕计。 唯有玉霄一府所统三十六天内院中司、东西华台、玄绾妙阁、四府六院，及诸有司，各分曹局，所以总司五雷天临三界者也。 天尊至皇，心亲庶政，此等小兆，以何因绿得以趋服，愿告欲闻。 注曰：雷师皓黄，乃帝臣元老，卿师重臣也。 玉霄府，即高上神霄天中玉清真王府，居三十六天之上天中。 有五殿，东曰药珠，西曰碧玉，北曰青华，南曰凝神，中曰长生。 又有太一内院，可韩中司，东西二台，四曹四局，外有大梵紫微之阁，仙都火雷之馆。 皆有玉府，左玄右玄，金阙侍中，仆射上相，真仙真伯，卿监侍宸，仙郎玉郎，玉童玉女，左右司麾，诸部雷神，官君将吏，上统三十六天。 东方八天谓高上道寂天，高上阳岐天，高上洞光天，高上紫冲天，高上玉灵天，高上清虚天，高上微果天，高上正心天。 南方八天； 高上道元天，高上太皇天，高上玄冲天，高上极真天，高上梵炁天，高上辅帝天，高上玄宗天，高上历变天。 西方八天：高上左罡天，高上主化天，高上符临天，高上保华天，高上定精天，高上青华天，高上景琅天，高上丹精天。 北方八天：高上安珲天，高上广宗天，高上浩帝天，高上希玄天，高上庆舍天，高上天娄天，高上变仙天，高上升玄天。 东北方高上敬皇天，东南方高上移神天，西南方高上琼灵天，西北方高上升极天。 下镇三十六垒，每方有九阳梵炁，以应一年三十六炁，每十日一炁上应。 天有一帝，统治一炁，天仙神鬼功过，付与本天校勘。 功者列名本天，过者囚於本天天狱。

At that time, the Heavenly Worthy examined the caskets of the Profound Azure Jade, reviewing the records of the Cavernous Subtlety and Luminous Dawn. Those who leaned close in whispered conference were the Heavenly Lords of the ten directions, seated in ordered ranks, sage transmitting to sage, together listening to the subtle and mysterious, the profound and arcane words. At that moment, each Heavenly Lord had his many household ministers standing respectfully by, attending with reverence.

The Heavenly Worthy sat in serene majesty, reciting the cavern scriptures. The Heavenly Lords, deeply enlightened, rose from their seats one by one, chanting long hymns and pacing the void in praise of the Heavenly Worthy’s teachings. Jade maidens and immortal sisters scattered flowers in circling dance around the Heavenly Worthy’s seat, then entreated the Heavenly Worthy to proceed to the Seven-Treasured Tiered Terrace of the Emerald Palace, desiring that the Heavenly Worthy expound the wondrous Dao. The tiered terrace was the Dragon-Phoenix Seat, with seven levels, each adorned with precious treasures—hence its name, the Seven-Treasured Tiered Terrace.

The Heavenly Worthy mounted his divine carriage, with white cranes and lions leading the way in solemn procession. Azure dragons and white tigers, the Six Jia and Six Ding spirits, guarded his left and right. The Nine Heavens’ immortal maidens and the Twelve Stream Perfected intoned celestial music. The Heavenly Great Emperors, Divine Lords, Divine Kings, and Supreme Perfected of the Great Ultimate followed in phoenix-scripted chariots and dragon-drawn carriages, traversing the Emerald Palace. Immortal banners and ritual halberds, dragon standards and simurgh chariots soared through the vast sky, assembling at the jeweled terrace.

Annotation: At that time, roaming the Heaven of Jade Clarity and halting at the jeweled terrace, the Heavenly Worthy grandly expounded the mysterious texts and broadly proclaimed the essential teachings. All the immortals and humans to his left and right opened their hearts to receive his transformation, their merit and practice thereby exalted.

Exegesis: At that time, our Heavenly Worthy was within his own celestial abode, where halls and chambers of the Nine Radiance Palace stood arrayed. There, he perused the scriptures and reviewed the canons, desiring to instruct the Heavenly Perfected Lords of the ten directions in the great Dao. Thus, the Heavenly Perfected Lords, robed in virtue and submitting in reverence, knew not how to dance in joy. The Heavenly Worthy, greatly pleased, wished to journey to the outer palaces. The myriad immortals and transcendents, to his left and right, before and behind, with ritual halberds and ordered banners, escorted our Heavenly Worthy to halt his simurgh carriage at the Emerald Palace. The Emerald Palace was the traveling palace of the Heaven of Jade Clarity.

The Thunder Master, his heart heavy with unspoken petitions, found no means to present them. By good fortune, our Heavenly Worthy ascended the jeweled terrace, raising his golden, radiant ruyi scepter to survey all beings below.

Eulogy:
Thus grasping the mysterious, the one aperture of the mysterious opens,
And the ten directions and three realms respond in due time.
The jade scriptures are perused with care to preserve the primordial qi,
The precious canons are proclaimed anew to nurture the original embryo.
The attendant maidens, leaning close, understand in their hearts,
The reverent ministers, standing in awe, compose their intent.
Suddenly, the teachings are expounded, and celestial flowers dance,
Phoenixes and simurghs soar gracefully above the Seven-Treasured Terrace.

At that moment, the Thunder Master, Elder Hao, stepped forth from the ranks of immortals, prostrated himself before the Heavenly Worthy, trembling in reverence, and knelt to address the Heavenly Worthy: “Greatly compassionate Heavenly Worthy, greatly sagely Heavenly Worthy, father of all beings, master of the myriad spirits—now, all the heavens enjoy this blessed audience. We have just witnessed the Heavenly Worthy perusing the precious canons and reviewing the jade scriptures, wherein lie boundless secrets beyond enumeration. Yet there is the Jade Firmament Prefecture, which governs the Inner Courts of the thirty-six heavens, the Eastern and Western Flower Terraces, the Mystic Coil Wondrous Chambers, the Four Prefectures and Six Courts, and all their subordinate offices, each with its own bureau and division—altogether, they oversee the Five Thunder Heavens’ descent into the three realms. O Most August Heavenly Worthy, your heart is ever close to the affairs of the multitudes. By what cause or condition might these minor omens be made to submit and serve? We humbly wish to hear your teaching.”

Annotation: The Thunder Master, Hao Huang, was an elder minister of the Celestial Emperor, a venerable preceptor and esteemed official. The Jade Firmament Prefecture was the Jade Clarity True King’s Court in the Highest Divine Firmament Heaven, residing above the thirty-six heavens. It comprised five halls: the Eastern Hall of Elixir Pearls, the Western Hall of Azure Jade, the Northern Hall of Azure Splendor, the Southern Hall of Concentrated Spirit, and the Central Hall of Longevity. There was also the Great One’s Inner Court, the Han Zhong Bureau, the Eastern and Western Terraces, the Four Offices and Four Divisions, and beyond them, the Great Brahmā Purple Tenuity Chambers and the Immortal Capital Fire-Thunder Halls. All had their jade prefectures, with the Left and Right Mysteries, the Golden Gates’ Chamberlains, the Chief Ministers, Supreme Ministers, Perfected Transcendents, Perfected Lords, Ministers and Attendants of the Celestial Court, Immortal Gentlemen, Jade Gentlemen, Jade Boys and Jade Maidens, Left and Right Commanders, and the various departments of thunder deities—officers, generals, and officials—who together governed the thirty-six heavens.

The thirty-six heavens were divided as follows:
**Eastern Eight Heavens:** Highest Dao Tranquility Heaven, Highest Yang Qi Heaven, Highest Cavernous Radiance Heaven, Highest Purple Impulse Heaven, Highest Jade Numinosity Heaven, Highest Clarity and Emptiness Heaven, Highest Subtle Fruit Heaven, Highest Rectified Heart Heaven.
**Southern Eight Heavens:** Highest Dao Origin Heaven, Highest Great August Heaven, Highest Mystic Impulse Heaven, Highest Ultimate Perfection Heaven, Highest Brahmā Qi Heaven, Highest Imperial Assistant Heaven, Highest Mystic Ancestry Heaven, Highest Sequential Transformation Heaven.
**Western Eight Heavens:** Highest Left Constellation Heaven, Highest Governance and Transformation Heaven, Highest Talisman Advent Heaven, Highest Preservation and Splendor Heaven, Highest Essence Stabilization Heaven, Highest Azure Splendor Heaven, Highest Scintillating Jade Heaven, Highest Cinnabar Essence Heaven.
**Northern Eight Heavens:** Highest Peace and Radiance Heaven, Highest Vast Ancestry Heaven, Highest Vast August Heaven, Highest Hopeful Mystery Heaven, Highest Celebratory Abode Heaven, Highest Celestial Tower Heaven, Highest Transformation and Immortality Heaven, Highest Ascending Mystery Heaven.
**Additional Heavens:** Highest Reverent August Heaven in the Northeast, Highest Spirit Shifting Heaven in the Southeast, Highest Jade Numinosity Heaven in the Southwest, Highest Ascending Ultimate Heaven in the Northwest.

Below, they oversaw the thirty-six ramparts, with each direction possessing nine yang Brahmā qi, corresponding to the thirty-six qi of the year, each qi ascending in ten-day cycles. Each heaven had its emperor, who governed one qi, and the merits and transgressions of heavenly immortals, spirits, and ghosts were submitted to their respective heavens for judgment. Those with merit were recorded in their heaven’s register, while those with transgressions were imprisoned in their heaven’s celestial dungeon.

chunks.original_text: 凡善恶事，三十六垒皇君，奏上神霄玉府而纠察也。 每天各有龙神兴雷，生杀伐暴诛邪，罔不由之。 四府者，九霄玉清府，东极青玄府，九天应元府，洞渊玉府。 六院者，太一内院，玉枢院，五雷院，斗枢院，氏阳院？ 仙都火雷院。 诸有司者，天部霆司，蓬莱都水司，太一雷霆司，北帝雷霆司，北斗征伐司，北斗防卫司，玉府雷霆九司，及诸曹院子司。 凡世间亢阳为雪，风雨不时，干戈妄动，饥馑荐臻，皆请命玉府，经由玉枢，大布分野。 兼判三司将兵三界鬼神功过，匡济黎民，应雷霆诸司院府并佐玉枢之令，禀听施行。 至於雷霆斧钺，庆赏刑威，有条不紊，悉有分司。 或曰兼司、行司、巡察官司，皆设曹局官僚任职。 是以玉霄一府，总司五雷天临三界者也。 义曰：天尊以琼书瑶笈，故化天真。 雷师默会天尊之旨，上请方便之门。 一时君臣体异心同无非，活群生之径路也。 诵经君子至此，当以雷师之心为心，其功有自归矣。 释曰：时我天尊登宝台察群品，似言不语。 适雷师皓翁，职专雷府，班越天真，以己心而识上心，故白之於天尊之前。 我天尊德化无边，真元有自，其玄书秘箓，不可条请。 故启三十六天束西二台府院诸司之政，莫不皆总之於玉霄一府。 其雷师皓翁以此举，而发我天尊之未宣者。 雷师启天尊至大至圣心及万品，臣以微陋之材，以何缘由得待玉宸，愿告天尊，明我前劫，以赞元化并玉霄一府之事，当屏气而恭听之。 赞曰：勃然长跪，上启真宗。 诸司院府台阁，尊崇。

All matters of good and evil are reported by the August Lords of the thirty-six ramparts to the Divine Numinous Jade Treasury for investigation and judgment. Each heaven possesses dragon spirits who summon thunder, giving life or executing death, punishing violence and slaying the wicked—nothing proceeds without their authority.

The Four Treasuries are: the Nine Numinous Jade Clarity Treasury, the Eastern Ultimate Azure Mystery Treasury, the Nine Heavens Responsive Primordial Treasury, and the Cavernous Abyss Jade Treasury. The Six Institutes are: the Supreme Unity Inner Institute, the Jade Pivot Institute, the Five Thunders Institute, the Dipper Pivot Institute, the Celestial Yang Institute, and the Immortal Capital Fire-Thunder Institute. The various administrative offices include: the Heavenly Department Thunder Bureau, the Penglai Capital Water Bureau, the Supreme Unity Thunder Bureau, the Northern Emperor Thunder Bureau, the Northern Dipper Punitive Expedition Bureau, the Northern Dipper Defense Bureau, the Jade Treasury Nine Thunder Bureaus, and the various subordinate offices and departments.

Whenever the world suffers from scorching yang, untimely winds and rains, reckless warfare, or repeated famines, petitions are submitted to the Jade Treasury, passing through the Jade Pivot, to be widely proclaimed across the celestial divisions. Concurrently, the Three Bureaus judge the merits and transgressions of the generals and soldiers, the ghosts and spirits of the Three Realms, aiding and rescuing the common people. All thunder-related offices, institutes, and treasuries assist the Jade Pivot’s decrees, receiving and executing them accordingly. As for the axes and halberds of thunder, the rewards and punishments, the commendations and executions—all proceed in perfect order, each under its designated office. Some are called concurrent bureaus, mobile bureaus, or inspection offices, all staffed with officials and functionaries.

Thus, the Jade Numinous Treasury alone governs the Five Thunders’ descent upon the Three Realms. In principle: the Heavenly Worthy, with jade scriptures and numinous texts, transforms the celestial perfected. The Thunder Masters silently comprehend the Heavenly Worthy’s intent, petitioning for the gates of expedient means. At such times, lord and ministers, though differing in form, share a single heart—nothing but opening the paths to enliven all beings. When reciting scriptures, the gentleman should take the Thunder Master’s heart as his own; thus, his merit will naturally find its return.

Explanation: At that time, our Heavenly Worthy ascended the Treasure Terrace to observe all beings, speaking without words. Just then, the Thunder Master, Radiant Elder, whose duty lies in the Thunder Treasury and who surpasses the celestial perfected, discerned the Heavenly Worthy’s heart with his own and thus addressed him. Our Heavenly Worthy’s virtue and transformation are boundless, the true and primordial having their own origin; his mysterious scriptures and secret registers cannot be enumerated in detail. Therefore, he revealed the governance of the thirty-six heavens’ eastern and western terrace treasuries, institutes, and bureaus—none not unified under the Jade Numinous Treasury. Through the Thunder Master Radiant Elder’s initiative, he brought forth what our Heavenly Worthy had not yet proclaimed.

The Thunder Master petitioned the Heavenly Worthy: “Your heart is most great and most sagely, encompassing the ten thousand kinds. Though I, your minister, am of humble talent, by what cause or reason may I attend the Jade Celestial Court? I beseech the Heavenly Worthy to clarify my former kalpas, that I may assist in the primordial transformation and the affairs of the Jade Numinous Treasury.” One should hold one’s breath and listen reverently.

Eulogy: Suddenly rising to kneel, he respectfully addressed the True Ancestor. All offices, institutes, treasuries, terraces, and pavilions—honor and veneration!

chunks.original_text: 三十六所。 云雷雨风。 何神不备何圣不从。 职专生杀，事在吉凶。 欲闻至说，必启丹衷。 仁哉仁哉，雷师皓翁。 天尊言：雷师皓翁，尔等仙卿，储勋夙世，累行昨生，故得玉府登庸，琼宫简录。 今兹勋行，视夙昨多。 尔其悉力雷司，委心火部。 日复日 岁复岁，勋崇行着，性霁神融，克证高真，即阶妙道。 惟是雷部鬼神，昼劳夕役，动有捶楚。 大则考戮。 屑云雕雪，无有已时，檄龙命鸦，此息彼作，彼所因故，尔其耳焉。 雷师皓翁，及诸天诸仙，耸耳而默。 天尊所坐九凤丹霞之扆，手举金光明之如意，琅风清微，绮云郁丽。 天尊寂然良久。 注曰：雷司布令行事，疾如风火，不可留停。 降泽之处有方，震雷之声有数，可旱即旱，可雨即雨，必奉帝勑。 其雷司所行，鬼神何以致也？ 盖此等之人，居尘世之上，不忠不孝，不仁不义，不礼三宝，不修五常，不惜五谷。 所以身没之后，听我雷司之驱役，实此等罪报也。 闻天尊所说善恶因绿，雷师皓翁及诸天诸仙启耳悚惧。 天尊所坐之时，其神风琅琅然而清微，彩云郁郁然而华丽，沉静良久，欲对仙众再演玄文也。 义曰：善根宜种，恶业莫生，天真尚然，累功积行，何况后学君子可不尽心乎。 释曰：雷师皓翁，与天地同体，日月齐明。 是以天尊言储勋夙世有大功，於初始之先行，既累着而得精炁，遂化成形，故得玉府进用琼宫有名矣。 今又掌善司恶，分化济人，其功不少。 所以尽心於火部者，乃雷师皓翁之本情也。 加之日积月增，名高行显，以全元炁，则性霁神融之不虚言也。 以是能与高上真王为明证之臣，遂列大道之阶。 天尊以善 恶两途论诸天真，复引雷部鬼神昼劳夕役周而复始无有休息。 所言屑云； 谓其奔走四方搏云作阵之劳。 雕雪者，其冒冻乘风凝雨作花之苦也。 至於入海檄其龙，走林命其鸦，东作西止，东伏西兴，无有息时，此善恶之因故明矣。 天尊是时语雷师曰：吾得权大化位上真，盖心先缝此道，故得如是也。 尔等欲升仙阼，赞化玄文，以吾之功为功，则道自成矣，尔今听焉。 诸天帝君闻如是说，皆耸耳而敬听也。 天尊之威仪，不可宣说，即有神风绮云清朗郁丽，天尊与九炁复合为一，寂然而不动也。 赞曰：善恶两途，特如影响。 善为天真，恶为魍魉。 天尊言：吾昔於千五百劫，以先心缝此道，遂位上真，意酿此功，遂权大化。 尝於大罗元始天尊前，以清浄心，发广大愿，愿於未来世，一切众生，天龙鬼神，一称吾名，悉使超涣。 如所否者，吾当以身身之。 尔等洗心，为尔宣说。
